abstract_summ: This case report outlines a possible challenging scenario that may encounter vascular interventionist when dealing with COVID-19 patients with respiratory compromise in prone position.Many centers have established prone ventilation in their treatment algorithm for mechanically ventilated patients with severe acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).Past work has found that intubated patients with ARDS experience physiological benefits to the prone position, as it promotes better matching of pulmonary perfusion to ventilation, improved secretion clearance, and recruitment of dependent areas of the lungs.Soon after arrival at our facility, the patient decompensated, developing severe ARDS requiring intubation and prone positioning to maintain adequate oxygenation.A large number of sick patients overwhelmed the health care system, and many centers faced a dearth of ventilators.
title_summ: A Single ED’s Experience During the COVID‐19 PandemicAchieving a Popliteal Venous Access for RRT in Critically Ill COVID-19 Patient in Prone positionHumidifier Use and Prone Positioning in a Patient with Severe COVID-19 Pneumonia and Endotracheal Tube Impaction Due to Highly Viscous Sputum“Conscious proning: An introduction of a proning protocol for non‐intubated, awake, hypoxic Emergency Department COVID‐19 patients”Reduced ICU demand with early CPAP and proning in COVID-19 at Bradford: a single centre cohortEarly Self‐Proning in Awake, Non‐intubated Patients in the Emergency Department:Proning in Non-Intubated (PINI) in Times of COVID-19: Case Series and a Review.
title_abstract_phrases: Humidifier Use and Prone Positioning in a Patient with Severe COVID-19 Pneumonia and Endotracheal Tube Impaction Due to Highly Viscous SputumCOVID-19 can lead to severe pneumonia, requiring mechanical ventilation.This case report outlines a possible challenging scenario that may encounter vascular interventionist when dealing with COVID-19 patients with respiratory compromise in prone position.Many centers have established prone ventilation in their treatment algorithm for mechanically ventilated patients with severe acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).Methods In this retrospective observational study we included all patients admitted with a positive COVID-19 PCR.A large number of sick patients overwhelmed the health care system, and many centers faced a dearth of ventilators.
